entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:38PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet Late Tonight Into Tuesday... Snow is expected to develop late tonight above 3000 feet and continue into Tuesday. Up to 3 inches is possible in Atigun Pass. with lesser amounts just below pass level.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:38PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 3000 Feet Late Tonight Into Tuesday... Snow is expected to develop late tonight above 3000 feet and continue into early Tuesday. Up to 3 inches of snow is possible above 3000 ft.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 3:38PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall Above 3000 feet Tuesday Into Wednesday... Snow is expected to develop above 3000 feet early on Tuesday and continue into Wednesday. Up to 6 inches of snow is possible above 3000 ft.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 19 at 10:49PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .An anomalous plume of moisture will move into the forecast area on Tuesday and last until early Friday. Additionally, a system moving through the Pacific Northwest and Northern Rockies will aid in the development of widespread showers and thunderstorms. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 2:44AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Locally dense fog can be expected with visibilities reduced to below a half mile at times. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for a sudden reductions in visibility during the morning commute. Conditions will improve later this morning when the fog burns off.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 1:42AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Fog in Portions of Northwest Indiana Early this Morning... Fog, some dense, will be seen across northwest Indiana early this morning, in particular in and near the Kankakee River Valley. This fog will persist at least through 4 to 5 A.M. and it is uncertain if this will linger into the start of the morning commute. Motorists prior to daybreak can expect sharply reduced visibility

entry.cap:areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; San Rafael Swell; South Central Utah; Western Canyonlands

entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 19 at 9:25PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. * WHEN...Through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Croix; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued September 19 at 9:07PM PDT until September 20 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty north winds and dry conditions Tuesday... .North winds will increase down the Okanogan Valley into Tuesday. Strong winds will be coupled with dry conditions Tuesday afternoon into the early evening increasing the potential for rapid spread of any new fires. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 1:29AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Barron and east central Polk Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 128 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Milltown, or 30 miles southeast of Pine City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
